meico.audio.lame.mp3

Class VBRTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.audio.lame.mp3.VBRTag

  • public class VBRTag
extends java.lang.Object
    A Vbr header may be present in the ancillary data field of the first frame of an mp3 bitstream
    The Vbr header (optionally) contains
    • frames total number of audio frames in the bitstream
    • bytes total number of bytes in the bitstream
    • toc table of contents

    toc (table of contents) gives seek points for random access.
    The ith entry determines the seek point for i-percent duration.
    seek point in bytes = (toc[i]/256.0) * total_bitstream_bytes
    e.g. half duration seek point = (toc[50]/256.0) * total_bitstream_bytes

 4 bytes for Header Flags
 100 bytes for entry (toc)

 4 bytes for stream size
 4 bytes for VBR scale. a VBR quality indicator: 0=best 100=worst
 20 bytes for LAME tag.  for example, "LAME3.12 (beta 6)"

      • putLameVBR

        private int putLameVBR(LameGlobalFlags gfp,
                       int musicLength,
                       byte[] streamBuffer,
                       int streamBufferPos,
                       int crc)
        Write LAME info: mini version + info on various switches used (Jonathan Dee 2001/08/31).
        Parameters:
        gfp - global flags
        musicLength - music length
        streamBuffer - pointer to output buffer
        streamBufferPos - offset into the output buffer
        crc - computation of CRC-16 of Lame Tag so far (starting at frame sync)
        Returns:
        number of bytes written to the stream
